Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 permeance decreases at higher temperatures due to dynamic aperture tightening by H3dhtp detritus dimers.
Ethane is excluded due to its larger size compared to the pore aperture dimensions.

Sieving Mechanism: Dynamic remediation of pore limiting diameter via H3dhtp detritus dimer motion

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas permeation tests using Wicke-Kallenbach method, Ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2/CO2 selectivity: 179 ± 71 at 298 K, H2/CO2 selectivity: 989 at 513 K, H2 permeance: 739 ± 289 GPU at 298 K, H2 permeance: 1330 GPU at 513 K

Other Information.Additional Info: The H3dhtp detritus dimers dynamically reshape the molecular sieving apertures in response to temperature changes, enhancing H2/CO2 selectivity at high temperatures.
